name.description: Name of the Front Door which is globally unique.

properties.description: The JSON object that contains the properties required to create an endpoint.

etag.description: Gets a unique read-only string that changes whenever the resource is updated.

name.description: The name of the Web Application Firewall Policy.

properties.description: Defines web application firewall policy properties.

etag.description: Gets a unique read-only string that changes whenever the resource is updated.

name.description: The Profile identifier associated with the Tenant and Partner

properties.description: Defines the properties of an experiment

name.description: The Experiment identifier associated with the Experiment

properties.description: Defines the properties of an experiment

address.description: Location of the backend (IP address or FQDN)

backendHostHeader.description: The value to use as the host header sent to the backend. If blank or unspecified, this defaults to the incoming host.

enabledState.description: Whether to enable use of this backend. Permitted values are 'Enabled' or 'Disabled'.

httpPort.description: The HTTP TCP port number. Must be between 1 and 65535.

httpsPort.description: The HTTPS TCP port number. Must be between 1 and 65535.

priority.description: Priority to use for load balancing. Higher priorities will not be used for load balancing if any lower priority backend is healthy.

weight.description: Weight of this endpoint for load balancing purposes.

Backend.description: Backend address of a frontDoor load balancer.

properties.description: The JSON object that contains the properties required to create a routing rule.

BackendPool.description: A backend pool is a collection of backends that can be routed to.

backends.description: The set of backends for this pool

BackendPoolProperties.description: The JSON object that contains the properties required to create a routing rule.

enforceCertificateNameCheck.description: Whether to enforce certificate name check on HTTPS requests to all backend pools. No effect on non-HTTPS requests.

sendRecvTimeoutSeconds.description: Send and receive timeout on forwarding request to the backend. When timeout is reached, the request fails and returns.

BackendPoolsSettings.description: Settings that apply to all backend pools.

dynamicCompression.description: Whether to use dynamic compression for cached content.

queryParameterStripDirective.description: Treatment of URL query terms when forming the cache key.

CacheConfiguration.description: Caching settings for a caching-type route. To disable caching, do not provide a cacheConfiguration object.

action.description: Describes what action to be applied when rule matches.

enabledState.description: Describes if the custom rule is in enabled or disabled state. Defaults to Enabled if not specified.

name.description: Describes the name of the rule.

priority.description: Describes priority of the rule. Rules with a lower value will be evaluated before rules with a higher value.

rateLimitDurationInMinutes.description: Time window for resetting the rate limit count. Default is 1 minute.

rateLimitThreshold.description: Number of allowed requests per client within the time window.

CustomRule.description: Defines contents of a web application rule

description.description: The description of the details or intents of the Experiment

ExperimentProperties.description: Defines the properties of an experiment

cacheConfiguration.description: Caching settings for a caching-type route. To disable caching, do not provide a cacheConfiguration object.

customForwardingPath.description: A custom path used to rewrite resource paths matched by this rule. Leave empty to use incoming path.

forwardingProtocol.description: Protocol this rule will use when forwarding traffic to backends.

backendPools.description: Backend pools available to routing rules.

backendPoolsSettings.description: Settings that apply to all backend pools.

enabledState.description: Operational status of the Front Door load balancer. Permitted values are 'Enabled' or 'Disabled'.

friendName.description: A friendly name for the frontDoor

frontendEndpoints.description: Frontend endpoints available to routing rules.

healthProbeSettings.description: Health probe settings associated with this Front Door instance.

loadBalancingSettings.description: Load balancing settings associated with this Front Door instance.

resourceState.description: Resource status of the Front Door.

routingRules.description: Routing rules associated with this Front Door.

FrontDoorProperties.description: The JSON object that contains the properties required to create an endpoint.

properties.description: The JSON object that contains the properties required to create a frontend endpoint.

FrontendEndpoint.description: A frontend endpoint used for routing.

hostName.description: The host name of the frontendEndpoint. Must be a domain name.

sessionAffinityEnabledState.description: Whether to allow session affinity on this host. Valid options are 'Enabled' or 'Disabled'.

sessionAffinityTtlSeconds.description: UNUSED. This field will be ignored. The TTL to use in seconds for session affinity, if applicable.

webApplicationFirewallPolicyLink.description: Defines the Web Application Firewall policy for each host (if applicable)

FrontendEndpointProperties.description: The JSON object that contains the properties required to create a frontend endpoint.

FrontendEndpointUpdateParametersWebAppli.description: Defines the Web Application Firewall policy for each host (if applicable)

properties.description: The JSON object that contains the properties required to create a health probe settings.

HealthProbeSettingsModel.description: Load balancing settings for a backend pool

enabledState.description: Whether to enable health probes to be made against backends defined under backendPools. Health probes can only be disabled if there is a single enabled backend in single enabled backend pool.

healthProbeMethod.description: Configures which HTTP method to use to probe the backends defined under backendPools.

intervalInSeconds.description: The number of seconds between health probes.

path.description: The path to use for the health probe. Default is /

protocol.description: Protocol scheme to use for this probe.

HealthProbeSettingsProperties.description: The JSON object that contains the properties required to create a health probe settings.

properties.description: The JSON object that contains the properties required to create load balancing settings

LoadBalancingSettingsModel.description: Load balancing settings for a backend pool

additionalLatencyMilliseconds.description: The additional latency in milliseconds for probes to fall into the lowest latency bucket

sampleSize.description: The number of samples to consider for load balancing decisions

successfulSamplesRequired.description: The number of samples within the sample period that must succeed

LoadBalancingSettingsProperties.description: The JSON object that contains the properties required to create load balancing settings

matchVariable.description: The variable type to be excluded.

selector.description: Selector value for which elements in the collection this exclusion applies to.

selectorMatchOperator.description: Comparison operator to apply to the selector when specifying which elements in the collection this exclusion applies to.

ManagedRuleExclusion.description: Exclude variables from managed rule evaluation.

exclusions.description: Describes the exclusions that are applied to all rules in the group.

ruleGroupName.description: Describes the managed rule group to override.

rules.description: List of rules that will be disabled. If none specified, all rules in the group will be disabled.

ManagedRuleGroupOverride.description: Defines a managed rule group override setting.

action.description: Describes the override action to be applied when rule matches.

enabledState.description: Describes if the managed rule is in enabled or disabled state. Defaults to Disabled if not specified.

exclusions.description: Describes the exclusions that are applied to this specific rule.

ManagedRuleOverride.description: Defines a managed rule group override setting.

exclusions.description: Describes the exclusions that are applied to all rules in the set.

ruleGroupOverrides.description: Defines the rule group overrides to apply to the rule set.

ruleSetType.description: Defines the rule set type to use.

ruleSetVersion.description: Defines the version of the rule set to use.

ManagedRuleSetList.description: Defines the list of managed rule sets for the policy.

negateCondition.description: Describes if the result of this condition should be negated.

operator.description: Comparison type to use for matching with the variable value.

selector.description: Match against a specific key from the QueryString, PostArgs, RequestHeader or Cookies variables. Default is null.

name.description: The Experiment identifier associated with the Experiment

properties.description: Defines the properties of an experiment

customBlockResponseBody.description: If the action type is block, customer can override the response body. The body must be specified in base64 encoding.

customBlockResponseStatusCode.description: If the action type is block, customer can override the response status code.

enabledState.description: Describes if the policy is in enabled or disabled state. Defaults to Enabled if not specified.

mode.description: Describes if it is in detection mode or prevention mode at policy level.

redirectUrl.description: If action type is redirect, this field represents redirect URL for the client.

ProfileProperties.description: Defines the properties of an experiment

customFragment.description: Fragment to add to the redirect URL. Fragment is the part of the URL that comes after #. Do not include the #.

customHost.description: Host to redirect. Leave empty to use the incoming host as the destination host.

customPath.description: The full path to redirect. Path cannot be empty and must start with /. Leave empty to use the incoming path as destination path.

customQueryString.description: The set of query strings to be placed in the redirect URL. Setting this value would replace any existing query string; leave empty to preserve the incoming query string. Query string must be in <key>=<value> format. The first ? and & will be added automatically so do not include them in the front, but do separate multiple query strings with &.

redirectProtocol.description: The protocol of the destination to where the traffic is redirected.

redirectType.description: The redirect type the rule will use when redirecting traffic.

RouteConfiguration.description: Base class for all types of Route.

properties.description: The JSON object that contains the properties required to create a routing rule.

RoutingRule.description: A routing rule represents a specification for traffic to treat and where to send it, along with health probe information.

acceptedProtocols.description: Protocol schemes to match for this rule

enabledState.description: Whether to enable use of this rule. Permitted values are 'Enabled' or 'Disabled'.

frontendEndpoints.description: Frontend endpoints associated with this rule

patternsToMatch.description: The route patterns of the rule.

routeConfiguration.description: Base class for all types of Route.

RoutingRuleProperties.description: The JSON object that contains the properties required to create a routing rule.

managedRules.description: Defines the list of managed rule sets for the policy.

WebApplicationFirewallPolicyProperties.description: Defines web application firewall policy properties.
